qas.question: What has many organizations claiming ownership of patents related to aspects of MP3 led to?
Legal threats and confusion made it difficult to ensure what about patents regarding MP3 products?
What was the danger of not correctly patenting products?
At what stage of the technology were these problems prevalent?

context: In the past, many organizations have claimed ownership of patents related to MP3 decoding or encoding. These claims led to a number of <a0_0>legal threats<a0_0/> and actions from a variety of sources. As a result, uncertainty about <a1_0>which patents must be licensed<a1_0/> in order to create MP3 products without committing <a2_0>patent infringement<a2_0/> in countries that allow software patents was a common feature of the <a3_0>early stages<a3_0/> of adoption of the technology.
